title: Azir's Shifting Sands
body: I think that azir's shifting sands should be able to knockup again .-. how else would you be able to get a chance to do something like burst em out. cos when azir is fighting a bruiser, its practically impossible because he does not have a chance to actually burst them out, they can just flash or walk around the wall cos the wall is small and also, he is vulnerable when he actually does use shifting sands

replies.body: There can be a chance where you will have to fight a bruiser mid, for example riven
get ganks or get countered, it's actually unfair that Azir is mostly countered by non-meta picks.

He is one of the best late game champions in the game, has one of the best ultimates for teamfights, has insane sustained AOE damage and has a near untouchable lane phase if played right. He doesn't need to be able to 1v1.

Azir is weak to bruisers because they're tanky enough to tank his semi-burst-semi-DPS damage. When he's up against short range mages, his zoning is ridiculous and really annoying.

It's balanced enough to me.
He will be nerfed further next year, just you wait.
Shurima Shuffling was way easier when his E used to knock-up, it's much harder to pull off now.

I think the rationale behind taking the knock up away was to make his play style a bit more trying to keep on the edge of a battle going in only to ult strategically rather than just E in are clean up.

plus his 1v1 was pretty strong with that knock up
